English: In the eighth month of the second year of Darius, the word of the LORD came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying
Bahnar: Khei tơhngam sơnăm mă 'bar lăm chăl Đarius pơgơ̆r. Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma hăm Sachari, 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, kon drŏ-nglo Bêrekia, sâu Iđô, thoi âu

English: “The LORD has been very angry with your fathers.
Bahnar: “Kră Yang ưh kơ lăp đon kơ yă 'bok iĕm.

English: Therefore say to them, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “Return to Me,” says the LORD of hosts, “and I will return to you,” says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na ih khŏm roi kơ kon pơlei pơla thoi âu: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: ‘Wih tơ Inh bĕ, na Inh gô wih tơ lu iĕm dơ̆ng,’ Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “Do not be like your fathers, to whom the former prophets preached, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “Turn now from your evil ways and your evil deeds.” ’ But they did not hear nor heed Me,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm thoi 'bok yă lu iĕm sơ̆ thoi lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol sơ̆ đei krao lu sư. Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei khan: ‘Dang ei weh bĕ đơ̆ng trong kơnê̆ păng đơ̆ng lu tơdrong pơm kơnê̆.’ Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ mơ̆ng, kuă kơ mơ̆ng Inh, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Your fathers, where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?
Bahnar: Bê̆ tơ yơ 'bok yă lu iĕm dang ei? Păng lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol noh hăm đei arih ling-lang ưh?

English: Yet surely My words and My statutes, Which I commanded My servants the prophets, Did they not overtake your fathers? “So they returned and said: ‘Just as the LORD of hosts determined to do to us, According to our ways and according to our deeds, So He has dealt with us.’ ” ’ ”
Bahnar: Na dôm nơ̆r Inh pơma păng khôi juăt Inh đei tơtă kơ lu đĭch đam inh bơngai khan lê̆ adrol ưh tam mă truh tơ lu 'bok yă iĕm hă? Na lu yă 'bok iĕm wih tơbral khan thoi âu: ‘Bơ̆n pơm ưh kơ lăp kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh na Sư phak bơ̆n boih kư̆m kiơ̆ thoi Sư đei pơkă.’ ”

English: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of the LORD came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet
Bahnar: Năr 'bar-jĭt puăn khei mơjĭt-mônh, noh khei Sa'bat, lăm sơnăm mă 'bar chăl Đarius, đei Kră Yang tơ'bôh ăn kơ Sachari 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, sư kon drŏ-nglo Bêrekia, sâu Iđô, thoi âu

English: I saw by night, and behold, a man riding on a red horse, and it stood among the myrtle trees in the hollow; and behind him were horses: red, sorrel, and white.
Bahnar: Kơmăng inh 'bôh; thoi 'nâu đei minh 'nu bơngai hao aseh hŭng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t tơm 'long pơgang tơ anih ala sŭng păng đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư đei lu aseh hŭng, aseh hơi, aseh hak.

English: Then I said, “My lord, what are these?” So the angel who talked with me said to me, “I will show you what they are.”
Bahnar: Inh khan thoi âu: “Ơ yŏng inh, lu aseh noh wă khan kiơ?” Na linh jang mă oei pơma hăm inh khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Inh gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih dôm lu aseh âu wă khan kiơ.”

English: And the man who stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, “These are the ones whom the LORD has sent to walk to and fro throughout the earth.”
Bahnar: Bơngai mă dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk lu 'long pơgang noh tơlang: “'Nâu mă lu bơngai Kră Yang wơh năm tơ jơ̆p-jang teh đak.”

English: So they answered the Angel of the LORD, who stood among the myrtle trees, and said, “We have walked to and fro throughout the earth, and behold, all the earth is resting quietly.”
Bahnar: Lu sư drơ̆ng linh jang mă dơ̆ng tơ tơm 'long pơgang noh thoi âu: “Lu nhôn đei năm jơ̆p boih kơ teh đak, đĭ-đăng jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak oei hiôk-hian.”

English: Then the Angel of the LORD answered and said, “O LORD of hosts, how long will You not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which You were angry these seventy years?”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh linh jang Kră Yang khan: “Ơ Kră Yang Tih hloh! Ih gô ưh pă 'mêm kơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng lu pơlei lăm char Juđa dĭng truh dang yơ? Noh boih lu pơlei tih mă Ih đei hil kơ lu sư tơpơh-jĭt sơnăm kơ âu?”

English: And the LORD answered the angel who talked to me, with good and comforting words.
Bahnar: Kră Yang iŏk dôm nơ̆r rơngơp nơ̆r pơlung tơl linh jang mă oei pơma hăm inh.

English: So the angel who spoke with me said to me, “Proclaim, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “I am zealous for Jerusalem And for Zion with great zeal.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh linh jang mă oei pơma hăm inh, khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Ôr krao păng khan Kră Yang Tih hloh đei khan: ‘Yua kơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng Siôn jơhngơ̆m inh ơh gar dêh.

English: I am exceedingly angry with the nations at ease; For I was a little angry, And they helped—but with evil intent.”
Bahnar: Păng Inh ưh kơ lăp jơhngơ̆m đon kơ adrĕch adrung mă oei hiôk. Sơ̆ Inh hli kơ kon pơlei pơla Inh lăp ai đĕch, mă-lei lu adrĕch adrung sư thim tơdrong pơmat kơ lu sư.’

English: ‘Therefore thus says the LORD: “I am returning to Jerusalem with mercy; My house shall be built in it,” says the LORD of hosts, “And a surveyor’s line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.” ’
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang khan thoi âu: ‘Inh iŏk jơhngơ̆m 'mêm mơnat dơ̆ng kơ Jêrusalem; Inh gô man pơdơ̆ng hnam Inh dơ̆ng tơ lăm sư, tơlei đak mơ̆k pơtŏ gô dăng tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.’ Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Again proclaim, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “My cities shall again spread out through prosperity; The LORD will again comfort Zion, And will again choose Jerusalem.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Ôr ră roi pă minh 'măng dơ̆ng bĕ thoi âu: ‘Lu pơlei tih Inh gô oei đei 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong hiôk jơnap, Kră Yang kư̆m oei pơlung Siôn păng oei rơih iŏk Jêrusalem.’ ”

English: Then I raised my eyes and looked, and there were four horns.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, inh ngơk muh măt, inh lăng, 'bôh đei puăn tŏ hơke.

English: And I said to the angel who talked with me, “What are these?” So he answered me, “These are the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”
Bahnar: Inh khan hloi kơ linh jang mă oei pơma hăm inh thoi âu: “Lu tơmam noh tơmam kiơ?” Sư tơl inh thoi âu: “Noh boih lu hơke mă đei pơm kơ char Juđa, Isơrael păng Jêrusalem pơchah đĭ.”

English: Then the LORD showed me four craftsmen.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Kră Yang tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh lăng puăn 'nu bơngai thơ̆ hơjơ̆m.

English: And I said, “What are these coming to do?” So he said, “These are the horns that scattered Judah, so that no one could lift up his head; but the craftsmen are coming to terrify them, to cast out the horns of the nations that lifted up their horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.”
Bahnar: Na inh apinh: “Lu bơngai âu truh wă pơm kiơ?” Sư tơl: “Noh boih lu hơke mă pơm kơ char Juđa pơchah đĭ, dĭng mah pă đei bu pơ̆n ngơk muh măt; mă-lei lu bơngai âu truh boih wă tơhli lu sư păng wă klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ lu hơke đơ̆ng dêh char nai mă đei yua hơke tơblah hăm teh đak Juđa wă pơrăm pơchah lê̆ sư.”

English: Then I raised my eyes and looked, and behold, a man with a measuring line in his hand.
Bahnar: Inh ngơk lăng dơ̆ng; 'bôh đei minh 'nu bơngai tơ ti sư chĕp tơlei pơtŏ.

English: So I said, “Where are you going?” And he said to me, “To measure Jerusalem, to see what is its width and what is its length.”
Bahnar: Inh đei pơma dơnuh hăm sư thoi âu: “Ih năm tơ yơ?” Sư tơl inh: “Inh wă năm pơtŏ lăng pơlei Jêrusalem âu, wơ̆l tor sư kơjung să dang yơ.”

English: And there was the angel who talked with me, going out; and another angel was coming out to meet him
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, linh jang mă oei pơma hăm inh sư yak năm păng đei minh 'nu linh jang nai sơng sư.

English: who said to him, “Run, speak to this young man, saying: ‘Jerusalem shall be inhabited as towns without walls, because of the multitude of men and livestock in it.
Bahnar: Păng khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Kơdâu năm roi kơ bơngai tơdăm noh bĕ: ‘Jêrusalem gô đei kon pơlei oei păng kư̆m nhen pơlei ưh kơ đei dur war, yua kơ đei lơ kon pơlei păng lu sem dơrong oei tơ lăm noh.’

English: For I,’ says the LORD, ‘will be a wall of fire all around her, and I will be the glory in her midst.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh, Kră Yang: ‘Inh gô pơm dur pơlei noh hăm ŭnh păng gô đei tơdrong ư-ang tơ lăm sư.’ ”

English: “Up, up! Flee from the land of the north,” says the LORD; “for I have spread you abroad like the four winds of heaven,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Ơ! Lu iĕm kơdâu ôn bĕ, kơdâu lĕch đơ̆ng teh đak gah yă-nơ̆m; yua kơ Inh đei pơm kơ lu iĕm tơklah tơklang tơ puăn pah kial tơ plĕnh.” Kră Yang khan thoi noh

English: “Up, Zion! Escape, you who dwell with the daughter of Babylon.”
Bahnar: “Ơ Siôn, ơ lu bơngai mă oei hơdai kon adruh Babilôn,a ih jah kơdâu ôn bĕ!”

English: For thus says the LORD of hosts: “He sent Me after glory, to the nations which plunder you; for he who touches you touches the apple of His eye.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơdrong ư-ang; na Sư wơh inh năm blah lu teh đak pơgŏ lu iĕm; yua kơ tơdah bu hơtŭt 'bơm lu iĕm, noh kư̆m thoi hơtŭt 'bơm kơ kon-ngai lăm măt Sư.

English: For surely I will shake My hand against them, and they shall become spoil for their servants. Then you will know that the LORD of hosts has sent Me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ âu, Inh gô yơ̆r ti Inh blah lu sư, lu sư gô jing tơmam lu bơngai jang kơ sư tơgar băl; păng lu iĕm gô băt kơ Kră Yang đei wơh inh truh tơ âu.

English: “Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion! For behold, I am coming and I will dwell in your midst,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ kon adruh Siôn, hơri chơt hiôk păng 'nă hal bĕ; yua kơ 'nâu, Inh truh păng Inh gô oei hơdai, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Many nations shall be joined to the LORD in that day, and they shall become My people. And I will dwell in your midst. Then you will know that the LORD of hosts has sent Me to you.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, đei lơ teh đak gô chu drap kơkuh kơ Kră Yang păng gô jing kon pơlei Inh, Inh gô oei hơdai lu iĕm, lu iĕm gô băt Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei wơh inh truh tơ iĕm.

English: And the LORD will take possession of Judah as His inheritance in the Holy Land, and will again choose Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô đei char Juđa pơm mŭk tơmam Sư lăm teh đak rơgoh păng Sư gô rơih iŏk Jêrusalem.

English: Be silent, all flesh, before the LORD, for He is aroused from His holy habitation!”
Bahnar: Dôm lu kon bơngai sĕch akar ngăn bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; yua kơ Sư iung hơđơ̆r boih đơ̆ng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư.”

English: Then he showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the Angel of the LORD, and Satan standing at his right hand to oppose him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Kră Yang ăn kơ inh 'bôh 'bok soi tơm Jôsua oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp linh jang Kră Yang păng Satana oei gah 'ma kơ sư wă kêng sư.

English: And the LORD said to Satan, “The LORD rebuke you, Satan! The LORD who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you! Is this not a brand plucked from the fire?”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Satan thoi âu: “Ơ Satan, thŭ Kră Yang hil hiap ih; Kră Yang Tơ'ngla mă rơih iŏk boih Jêrusalem hil chrih kơ ih. 'Nâu hăm trŏ thoi kơtôch đe 'nao dui đơ̆ng ŭnh?”

English: Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and was standing before the Angel.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei Jôsua hrŭk ao mơgrĭ, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp linh jang.

English: Then He answered and spoke to those who stood before Him, saying, “Take away the filthy garments from him.” And to him He said, “See, I have removed your iniquity from you, and I will clothe you with rich robes.”
Bahnar: Linh jang khan kơ lu bơngai mă oei 'bơ̆t anăp sư thoi âu: “Plôh bĕ ao mơgrĭ noh đơ̆ng akâu sư.” Păng khan đơ̆ng kơ Jôsua thoi âu: “Lăng bĕ, Inh hŭt lê̆ boih tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ đơ̆ng ih.”

English: And I said, “Let them put a clean turban on his head.” So they put a clean turban on his head, and they put the clothes on him. And the Angel of the LORD stood by.
Bahnar: Inh khan dơ̆ng: “Yơ̆l bĕ môk rơgoh tơ kơpal kơ̆l ih.” Thoi noh đe pơyơ̆l ăn môk rơgoh tơ kơ̆l sư; đơ̆ng noh đe pơhrŭk ăn ao tai kơ sư; linh jang Kră Yang oei dơ̆ng tơ noh.

English: Then the Angel of the LORD admonished Joshua, saying
Bahnar: Linh jang Kră Yang tơtă kơ Jôsua thoi âu

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘If you will walk in My ways, And if you will keep My command, Then you shall also judge My house, And likewise have charge of My courts; I will give you places to walk Among these who stand here.
Bahnar: “Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: ‘Tơdah ih năm yak kiơ̆ lăm trong Inh, chu yom, wei răk dôm nơ̆r Inh bơtho, na ih gô wei-lăng hnam Inh păng bơwei cham hnam Inh, Inh gô ăn kơ ih nơnăm tŏk-bŏk lu bơngai mă oei kơkuh kơ Inh âu.

English: ‘Hear, O Joshua, the high priest, You and your companions who sit before you, For they are a wondrous sign; For behold, I am bringing forth My Servant the BRANCH.
Bahnar: Ơ Jôsua, 'bok soi tơm, ih hăm buăl ih mă oei 'bơ̆t anăp ih mơ̆ng bĕ, yua kơ lu bơngai âu wă pơm tơdra; 'nâu sĭt tơpă Inh gô pơm kơ lu đĭch đam Inh bluh tơmơ̆ng iung chăt.

English: For behold, the stone That I have laid before Joshua: Upon the stone are seven eyes. Behold, I will engrave its inscription,’ Says the LORD of hosts, ‘And I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, tơmo mă inh đei dan 'bơ̆t anăp Jôsua noh minh kơtuăl tơmo mă-lei tơpơh tŏ măt. 'Nâu, Inh gô chrek chư tơ noh păng inh gô iŏk hŭt lê̆ tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng teh âu lăm minh năr.’ ” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh

English: In that day,’ says the LORD of hosts, ‘Everyone will invite his neighbor Under his vine and under his fig tree.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lăm năr noh, lu iĕm gô krao pơtơm lu bôl buăl rông 'bôt hơ-oei ala tơm hơmu păng tơm 'long hơra.”

English: Now the angel who talked with me came back and wakened me, as a man who is wakened out of his sleep.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh ling jang khan hăm inh, wơ̆t râu tơiung inh dơ̆ng, thoi minh 'nu bơngai oei tep na râu tơiung sư.

English: And he said to me, “What do you see?” So I said, “I am looking, and there is a lampstand of solid gold with a bowl on top of it, and on the stand seven lamps with seven pipes to the seven lamps.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Ih 'bôh kiơ?” Inh tơl: “To inh 'bôh boih minh pôm jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng pơm păng maih ngăl păng đei minh hlak pơnhan chhĕr kơpal sư, đei tơpơh tŏ pla ŭnh kơđeng, đei tơpơh tŏ đing kơ rim kơpal ŭnh kơđeng noh.

English: Two olive trees are by it, one at the right of the bowl and the other at its left.”
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t cheng sư đei 'bar tơnơm 'long ôliwơ, minh tơnơm gah 'ma kơ pơnhan chhĕr păng minh pôm gah 'ngiĕo.”*

English: So I answered and spoke to the angel who talked with me, saying, “What are these, my lord?”
Bahnar: Inh apinh linh jang mă oei pơma hăm inh thoi âu: “Ơ yŏng inh, dôm tơdrong âu wă khan kiơ?”

English: Then the angel who talked with me answered and said to me, “Do you not know what these are?” And I said, “No, my lord.”
Bahnar: Linh jang ei khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Ih ưh kơ băt dôm tơdrong 'nâu wă khan kiơ hă?” Inh khan: “Ơ yŏng inh! Inh ưh kơ băt.”

English: So he answered and said to me: “This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel: ‘Not by might nor by power, but by My Spirit,’ Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Sư tơl inh: “'Nâu jơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Sôrôbabel, thoi âu: ‘Noh ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng tơdrong gơh hơgei, kư̆m ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng tơdrong pran kơtang ôh, mă-lei đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Inh.’ Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.*

English: ‘Who are you, O great mountain? Before Zerubbabel you shall become a plain! And he shall bring forth the capstone With shouts of “Grace, grace to it!” ’ ”
Bahnar: Ơ kông tih ih bu? 'Bơ̆t anăp Sôrôbabel ih gô jing teh dơhnă đe gô anhăk lê̆ tơmo mă kơpal hloh noh tơ nai, gô đei nơ̆r đe ôr krao thoi âu: ‘Apinh tơdrong mơnat, mơnat ăn kơ sư!’ ”

English: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei dơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh.

English: “The hands of Zerubbabel Have laid the foundation of this temple; His hands shall also finish it. Then you will know That the LORD of hosts has sent Me to you.
Bahnar: “Đơ̆ng ti Sôrôbabel đei pơjing hnam 'nâu păng ti sư kư̆m gô pơm keh mơ̆n.” Kơplah noh ih gô băt Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei wơh inh năm tơ lu iĕm.

English: For who has despised the day of small things? For these seven rejoice to see The plumb line in the hand of Zerubbabel. They are the eyes of the LORD, Which scan to and fro throughout the whole earth.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ bu pơ̆n pơjăm kơ năr tơdrong iĕ âu? Sư gô chơt hiôk 'bôh tơlei dăng pơtŏ 'bơ̆t ti Sôrôbabel.* Đei tơpơh tŏ măt 'nâu măt Kră Yang năm tơmang lăng jơ̆p kơ teh đak.

English: Then I answered and said to him, “What are these two olive trees—at the right of the lampstand and at its left?”
Bahnar: Inh tơl sư thoi âu: “'Bar tơnơm 'long ôliwơ minh tơnơm gah 'ma minh tơnơm gah 'ngiĕo kơ jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng noh wă khan kiơ?”

English: And I further answered and said to him, “What are these two olive branches that drip into the receptacles of the two gold pipes from which the golden oil drains?”
Bahnar: Inh apinh sư mă 'bar dơ̆ng thoi âu: “'Bar tŏ dơng ôliwơ 'bar pah kơ đing maih, đei đak maih ro, noh wă khan kiơ?”

English: Then he answered me and said, “Do you not know what these are?” And I said, “No, my lord.”
Bahnar: Sư tơl inh thoi âu: “Ih ưh kơ băt noh khan kiơ hă?” Inh drơ̆ng: “Ơ Yŏng inh, inh ưh kơ băt.”

English: So he said, “These are the two anointed ones, who stand beside the Lord of the whole earth.”
Bahnar: Sư khan thoi âu: “Noh wă khan đei 'bar 'nu chu tuh đak rơmă, dơ̆ng cheng 'bơ̆t Kră Yang mă Yang kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak.”

English: Then I turned and raised my eyes, and saw there a flying scroll.
Bahnar: Inh ngơk păng bơyar măt inh lăng dơ̆ng, na 'bôh đei minh sơ̆p hla bơar akar đông!

English: And he said to me, “What do you see?” So I answered, “I see a flying scroll. Its length is twenty cubits and its width ten cubits.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: “Ih 'bôh kiơ?” Inh tơl sư: “Inh 'bôh đei sơ̆p hla bơar akar oei đông, să tor sư 'bar-jĭt plaih, wơ̆l sư mơjĭt plaih.”

English: Then he said to me, “This is the curse that goes out over the face of the whole earth: ‘Every thief shall be expelled,’ according to this side of the scroll; and, ‘Every perjurer shall be expelled,’ according to that side of it.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư khan kơ inh: “'Nâu jing tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak; yua kơ kiơ̆ kơ sơ̆p hla bơar đei chih boih tơ gah minh pah, rim 'nu bơngai bu mă tơtông klĕ đe gô pơrăm lê̆ sư, đơ̆ng noh kư̆m kiơ̆ kơ hla bơar đei chih tơ minh pah nai dơ̆ng bơngai bu mă kăt tơdra hơkar hơlĕnh đe kư̆m gô pơrăm lê̆ sư.”

English: “I will send out the curse,” says the LORD of hosts; “It shall enter the house of the thief And the house of the one who swears falsely by My name. It shall remain in the midst of his house And consume it, with its timber and stones.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh gô wơh sơ̆p hla bơar âu năm, đơ̆ng noh sư gô mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam lu bơngai tơtông păng tơ hnam lu bơngai pơkă hơlĕnh; thoi noh sư oei hloi tơ lăm hnam lu đe noh păng sư gô pơrăm lê̆ hnam noh, mă khan pơm păng 'long dah păng tơmo.”

English: Then the angel who talked with me came out and said to me, “Lift your eyes now, and see what this is that goes forth.”
Bahnar: Linh jang mă pơma hăm inh lĕch weh păng khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Dang ei ih ngơk lăng 'bôh kiơ lĕch to.”

English: So I asked, “What is it?” And he said, “It is a basket that is going forth.” He also said, “This is their resemblance throughout the earth
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Noh kiơ?” Sư tơl inh thoi âu: “Noh boih jơ̆ minh pôm ephaa lĕch.” Sư khan kơ inh dơ̆ng: “Noh rup tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.”

English: Here is a lead disc lifted up, and this is a woman sitting inside the basket”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, inh 'bôh minh kơtuăl bơlơ̆k đei pôk hơtŏk lê̆ păng đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn hơ-oei lăm epha.

English: then he said, “This is Wickedness!” And he thrust her down into the basket, and threw the lead cover over its mouth.
Bahnar: Sư khan thoi âu: “Noh tơdrong kơnê̆.” Đơ̆ng noh đe tơlơ̆ sư tơ lăm epha dơ̆ng păng tơhuŏng kơtuăl bơlơ̆k noh klơ̆p lê̆ 'măng epha.

English: Then I raised my eyes and looked, and there were two women, coming with the wind in their wings; for they had wings like the wings of a stork, and they lifted up the basket between earth and heaven.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh ngơk lăng, 'nâu, đei 'bar 'nu drŏ-kăn lĕch, tơklă anăp inh. Đei kial đơ̆ng lăm pơnăr lu sư, na lu sư đei pơnăr thoi pơnăr klang kok; păng lu bơngai pôk epha dan tŏk-bŏk teh hăm plĕnh.

English: So I said to the angel who talked with me, “Where are they carrying the basket?”
Bahnar: Inh apinh linh jang mă pơma hăm inh: “Lu sư pôk chĕp ba epha năm tơ yơ?”

English: And he said to me, “To build a house for it in the land of Shinar; when it is ready, the basket will be set there on its base.”
Bahnar: Sư tơl inh thoi âu: “Noh jơ̆ wă pơjing ăn hnam kơ epha tơ lăm dêh char Sinar, mưh đei hơmet lê̆ keh boih na dan sư tơ anih đêl sư noh.”

English: Then I turned and raised my eyes and looked, and behold, four chariots were coming from between two mountains, and the mountains were mountains of bronze.
Bahnar: Inh ngơk lăng dơ̆ng na 'bôh puăn tŏ gre aseh lĕch đơ̆ng sơlam kông. Kông noh kông hu.

English: With the first chariot were red horses, with the second chariot black horses
Bahnar: Gre aseh mă minh noh aseh 'brê, gre aseh mă 'bar noh aseh găm.*

English: with the third chariot white horses, and with the fourth chariot dappled horses—strong steeds.
Bahnar: Gre aseh mă pêng noh aseh kok, đơ̆ng noh gre aseh mă puăn noh aseh brông drơ̆k-drơ̆l.*

English: Then I answered and said to the angel who talked with me, “What are these, my lord?”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh apinh linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă oei pơma dơnuh hăm inh: “Ơ yŏng inh! Lu 'nâu wă pơtih kơ kiơ?”

English: And the angel answered and said to me, “These are four spirits of heaven, who go out from their station before the Lord of all the earth.
Bahnar: Linh jang khan dơ̆ng kơ inh: “Noh kiala đơ̆ng plĕnh, lĕch đơ̆ng lăm anih lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang mă Kră Yang kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak.

English: The one with the black horses is going to the north country, the white are going after them, and the dappled are going toward the south country.”
Bahnar: Gre mă đei aseh găm sư dui gre năm tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, gre mă aseh kok năm tơpăt tơ gah bơmơ̆t, đơ̆ng noh aseh brông drơ̆k-drơ̆l năm tơklă tơ gah gơal.”

English: Then the strong steeds went out, eager to go, that they might walk to and fro throughout the earth. And He said, “Go, walk to and fro throughout the earth.” So they walked to and fro throughout the earth.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh đei lu aseh pran lĕch wă năm dăr juang jơ̆p kơ teh đak, Sư khan: “Năm bĕ, lăng teh đak.” Đơ̆ng noh, lu sư năm chă lăng teh đak.

English: And He called to me, and spoke to me, saying, “See, those who go toward the north country have given rest to My Spirit in the north country.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư krao inh: “'Nâu, lu aseh năm tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, ăn kơ Yang Bơhngol Inh oei pơdơh tơ gah yă-nơ̆m noh.”

English: Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: “Receive the gift from the captives—from Heldai, Tobijah, and Jedaiah, who have come from Babylon—and go the same day and enter the house of Josiah the son of Zephaniah.
Bahnar: “Iŏk bĕ jên dah maih đơ̆ng lu adrĕch Helđai, Tôbia păng Jêđaia, lu bơngai bơnă mă đơ̆ng Babilôn, kư̆m lăm năr noh mơ̆n năm bĕ tơ hnam Jôsia kon drŏ-nglo Sêphania.

English: Take the silver and gold, make an elaborate crown, and set it on the head of Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest.
Bahnar: Iŏk jên dah maih đơ̆ng sư, pơm bĕ minh tŏ môk pơtao na pơyơ̆l ăn bĕ tơ kơ̆l Jôsua 'bok soi tơm kon dăm Jêhôsađak.

English: Then speak to him, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts, saying: “Behold, the Man whose name is the BRANCH! From His place He shall branch out, And He shall build the temple of the LORD
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ sư, Kră Yang Tih hloh khan: ‘'Nâu, đei minh 'nu anăn dơ̆ng, sư gô chăt đơ̆ng ih păng bơngai noh gô pơjing hnam kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Yes, He shall build the temple of the LORD. He shall bear the glory, And shall sit and rule on His throne; So He shall be a priest on His throne, And the counsel of peace shall be between them both.” ’
Bahnar: Sư boih wă man hnam kơkuh kơ Kră Yang; păng sư boih đe gô ư-ang, oei pơgơ̆r tơ anih tang-dŏ pơtao sư păng pơm 'bok soi tơm tơ anih pơtao sư, sư kư̆m pơgơ̆p hiôk-hian kơ 'bar tơdrong noh.’

English: “Now the elaborate crown shall be for a memorial in the temple of the LORD for Helem, Tobijah, Jedaiah, and Hen the son of Zephaniah.
Bahnar: Môk pơtao gô oei lăm Hnam Kră Yang jing tơmam wă kơ 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Helđai, Tôbia, Jêđaia păng Hen kon dăm Sêphania.”

English: Even those from afar shall come and build the temple of the LORD. Then you shall know that the LORD of hosts has sent Me to you. And this shall come to pass if you diligently obey the voice of the LORD your God.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai đơ̆ng ataih năm păng tơgŭm pơjing pơdơ̆ng hnam Kră Yang; păng ih gô băt Kră Yang Tih hloh wơh boih inh năm tơ âu. Tơdah ih chơgăm pơnam pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, na tơdrong noh gô truh.

English: Now in the fourth year of King Darius it came to pass that the word of the LORD came to Zechariah, on the fourth day of the ninth month, Chislev
Bahnar: Đei tơdrong truh lăm sơnăm mă puăn chăl pơtao Đarius, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Sachari trŏ năr puăn khei tơsĭn Kisle.

English: when the people sent Sherezer, with Regem-Melech and his men, to the house of God, to pray before the LORD
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei Bethel đei wơh bre Sareser hăm Rêgêmalek hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ wă apinh tơdrong mơnat đơ̆ng Kră Yang

English: and to ask the priests who were in the house of the LORD of hosts, and the prophets, saying, “Should I weep in the fifth month and fast as I have done for so many years?”
Bahnar: păng pơma hăm lu 'bok soi lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei păng hăm lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol thoi âu: “Inh hăm pă nhơ̆m hmoi păng ngôi adrô̆ lăm khei pơđăm thoi inh ngăl juăt kơ đei pơm boih lăm lơ sơnăm noh sơ̆?”

English: Then the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying
Bahnar: Dang ei đei nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan kơ inh thoi âu

English: “Say to all the people of the land, and to the priests: ‘When you fasted and mourned in the fifth and seventh months during those seventy years, did you really fast for Me—for Me?
Bahnar: “Khan bĕ kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei kơpal teh păng lu 'bok soi thoi âu: ‘Lu iĕm nhơ̆m hmoi, ơ̆t kơ por lăm khei pơđăm, khei tơpơh, đei tơpơh-jĭt sơnăm kơ 'nâu, hăm trŏ yua kơ inh, iĕm ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa noh?

English: When you eat and when you drink, do you not eat and drink for yourselves?
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm et sa păng sŏng sa, hăm trŏ ưh kơ sĭ yua kơdih iĕm na et sŏng sa? Yua kơ iĕm kơdih et sŏng sa hă?

English: Should you not have obeyed the words which the LORD proclaimed through the former prophets when Jerusalem and the cities around it were inhabited and prosperous, and the South and the Lowland were inhabited?’ ”
Bahnar: Noh hăm trŏ khan ưh kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang yua lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol chăl sơ̆ roi tơbăt, kơplah Jêrusalem păng lu pơlei tih tăp dăr sư đei kon pơlei oei păng hrôh ngôh păng kơplah gah gơal păng gah hơlĕch đei kon pơlei oei boih?’ ”

English: Then the word of the LORD came to Zechariah, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Sachari

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Execute true justice, Show mercy and compassion Everyone to his brother.
Bahnar: “Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: ‘Pơm bĕ dôm tơdrong kiơ mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng rim 'nu athei iơ̆m dim, 'mêm mơnat kơ 'nhŏng oh

English: Do not oppress the widow or the fatherless, The alien or the poor. Let none of you plan evil in his heart Against his brother.’
Bahnar: 'nĕ pơjuă pơđep lu yă adro po, dah lu mơti mơtuei, dah lu tơmoi nai 'nao oei, dah lu bơngai dơnuh hoh păng rim 'nu mă bu bu kư̆m 'nĕ pơm đon kơnê̆ hăm lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n kơdih.’

English: “But they refused to heed, shrugged their shoulders, and stopped their ears so that they could not hear.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, tơwih rŏng păng chĭt lê̆ đon kuă kơ mơ̆ng.

English: Yes, they made their hearts like flint, refusing to hear the law and the words which the LORD of hosts had sent by His Spirit through the former prophets. Thus great wrath came from the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m lu sư arăng thoi tơmo jơmŏng kuă kơ mơ̆ng khôi juăt mă Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei ăn boih Yang Bơhngol Sư yua lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol kră sơ̆ mă Sư đei wơh; yua kơ thoi noh na đei tơdrong hil tih dêh đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: Therefore it happened, that just as He proclaimed and they would not hear, so they called out and I would not listen,” says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Đei tơdrong truh thoi kơplah Inh krao, lu sư ưh kơ chu mơ̆ng, na kơplah lu sư krao Inh kư̆m ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “But I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations which they had not known. Thus the land became desolate after them, so that no one passed through or returned; for they made the pleasant land desolate.”
Bahnar: Inh đei pơm ăn kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang thoi đei kial hơbŭt tih tơ jơ̆p-jang lăm teh đak mă lu sư tam mă biơh băt; na lăm teh đak jing juơ, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư noh, dĭng mah pă đei bu năm rok noh wih brŏk tơ noh; yua kơ lu sư pơm ăn kơ teh đak đơ̆ng chơt hiôk jing juơ juŏ.’ ”

English: Again the word of the LORD of hosts came, saying
Bahnar: Đei dơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih hloh khan kơ inh thoi âu

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘I am zealous for Zion with great zeal; With great fervor I am zealous for her.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh hil gar Siôn hăm tơdrong Inh gar kơtang, đêl inh gar boih sư hăm tơdrong hil mĭl.”

English: “Thus says the LORD: ‘I will return to Zion, And dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. Jerusalem shall be called the City of Truth, The Mountain of the LORD of hosts, The Holy Mountain.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh wih dơ̆ng tơ Siôn păng inh gô oei tơ Jêrusalem; Jêrusalem đe gô krao sư pơlei sĭt tơpăt; kông Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô krao kông Rơgoh.”

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Old men and old women shall again sit In the streets of Jerusalem, Each one with his staff in his hand Because of great age.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: “Gô oei đei lu 'bok kră yă kră oei tơ rok trong pơlei Jêrusalem, bu bu kư̆m tă kơ chĕp 'long jra ngăl, yua kơ kră boih.

English: The streets of the city Shall be full of boys and girls Playing in its streets.’
Bahnar: Lu trong tih lăm pơlei gô 'bĕnh kơ lu bơngai drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn ngôi chơt lăm noh.”

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘If it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in these days, Will it also be marvelous in My eyes?’ Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh: “Lăm lu năr noh mă khan măt lu kon pơlei mă oei arih lăng hlĭch hlăch ră, mă-lei măt inh ưh kơ hlĭch?” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Behold, I will save My people from the land of the east And from the land of the west
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: “'Nâu Inh gô dŏng pơklaih kon pơlei Inh đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch gah bơmơ̆t

English: I will bring them back, And they shall dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. They shall be My people And I will be their God, In truth and righteousness.’
Bahnar: păng ba lu sư brŏk, lu sư gô oei tơ lăm Jêrusalem, jing kon pơlei Inh, gah Inh jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư lăm tơdrong sĭt păng tơpăt.”

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Let your hands be strong, You who have been hearing in these days These words by the mouth of the prophets, Who spoke in the day the foundation was laid For the house of the LORD of hosts, That the temple might be built.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: “Ơ lu iĕm jơ̆ bơngai mă kơtơ̆ng năr 'nâu, kơtơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r noh đơ̆ng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol lăm năr mă hnam akŭm Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei pơdơ̆ng pơjing boih, na lu iĕm pơm bĕ kơ ti lu iĕm jing pran.

English: For before these days There were no wages for man nor any hire for beast; There was no peace from the enemy for whoever went out or came in; For I set all men, everyone, against his neighbor.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơbăt lê̆ adrol kơ lu năr noh đe ưh kơ apah ôh dôm tơdrong kon bơngai jang lu kon sem dơrong jang; păng yua kơ lu ayăt, na ưh kơ đei tơdrong hiôk rơnŭk kơ lu bơngai lĕch dah lu bơngai mơ̆t; yua kơ Inh đei pơm ăn boih kơ kon bơngai rim 'nu tơblah tơduă hăm lu rông 'bôt sư kơdih.

English: But now I will not treat the remnant of this people as in the former days,’ says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei Inh ưh kơ ăn ôh lu bơngai mă oei lăm lu kon pơlei 'nâu thoi adrol.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: ‘For the seed shall be prosperous, The vine shall give its fruit, The ground shall give her increase, And the heavens shall give their dew— I will cause the remnant of this people To possess all these.
Bahnar: “Yua kơ tơ noh gô đei găr adrĕch hiôk-hian; tơm hơmu gô đei plei păng teh gô jing mơ̆r chăt lu tơmam sa, đơ̆ng plĕnh gô đei tŭk jur, Inh gô pơm kơ lu kon pơlei mă oei oei âu gơh yua dôm tơdrong noh.

English: And it shall come to pass That just as you were a curse among the nations, O house of Judah and house of Israel, So I will save you, and you shall be a blessing. Do not fear, Let your hands be strong.’
Bahnar: Ơ hnam Juđa păng hnam Isơrael! Gô đei tơdrong thoi đe hiap iĕm lăm teh đak thoi yơ, na Inh gô dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm păng lu iĕm gô đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk thoi noh. Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli mă-lei ti iĕm athei pran kơtang.”

English: “For thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Just as I determined to punish you When your fathers provoked Me to wrath,’ Says the LORD of hosts, ‘And I would not relent
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Thoi Inh đei ăn tơdrong răm tơ lu iĕm, kơplah lu 'bok yă iĕm pơm tơblĕk Inh, Inh đei pơkă boih wă phak lu iĕm, Inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh

English: So again in these days I am determined to do good To Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Do not fear.
Bahnar: “na năr 'nâu kư̆m lei-lăi, Inh pơkă wă pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng hnam Juđa: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli!

English: These are the things you shall do: Speak each man the truth to his neighbor; Give judgment in your gates for truth, justice, and peace
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong lu iĕm athei pơm: Athei pơma tơpăt dih băl, arih hiôk chơt hăm rông 'bôt, athei sek tơlang mă tơpăt hơnơ̆ng.

English: Let none of you think evil in your heart against your neighbor; And do not love a false oath. For all these are things that I hate,’ Says the LORD.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ chă tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm jơhngơ̆m 'nĕ kơ tơhil hăm lu rông 'bôt; păng 'nĕ kơ pơma hơlĕnh, yua kơ noh jơ̆ tơdrong mă Inh areh.” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Then the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, đei nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan kơ inh

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘The fast of the fourth month, The fast of the fifth, The fast of the seventh, And the fast of the tenth, Shall be joy and gladness and cheerful feasts For the house of Judah. Therefore love truth and peace.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei khan thoi âu: “Tơdrong ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa lăm khei puăn păng tơdrong ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa lăm khei pơđăm, tơdrong ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa lăm khei tơpơh, tơdrong ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa lăm khei mơjĭt noh gô đei tơdrong chơt hiôk, 'nă hal păng et sa chơt hiôk kơ hnam Juđa. Thoi noh hưch hanh bĕ tơdrong tơpăt păng chơt hiôk.”

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Peoples shall yet come, Inhabitants of many cities
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: “Gô đei lơ lu kon pơlei păng lu kon pơlei nai mă oei tơ lăm pơlei tih gô truh

English: The inhabitants of one city shall go to another, saying, “Let us continue to go and pray before the LORD, And seek the LORD of hosts. I myself will go also.”
Bahnar: păng gô đei kon pơlei 'nâu năm tơ pơlei nai păng khan thoi âu: ‘Bĕ lu bơ̆n yak mă kuăng, wă kơ apinh tơdrong mơnat đơ̆ng Kră Yang păng chơchă Kră Yang Tih Hloh; inh kư̆m gô năm.’

English: Yes, many peoples and strong nations Shall come to seek the LORD of hosts in Jerusalem, And to pray before the LORD.’
Bahnar: Thoi noh đei lơ kon pơlei păng lu adrĕch adrung lăm teh đak pran kơtang gô năm chă Kră Yang Tih Hloh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng apinh tơdrong mơnat đơ̆ng Kră Yang tơ noh.”

English: “Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘In those days ten men from every language of the nations shall grasp the sleeve of a Jewish man, saying, “Let us go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: “Gô đei mơjĭt 'nu đơ̆ng rim nơ̆r pơma păng rim kơ dêh char, rôp kơjăp ao minh 'nu bơngai Juđa păng khan: Ăn kơ nhôn năm hơdai ih, yua kơ nhôn kơtơ̆ng Kră Yang oei hơdai ih.’ ”

English: The burden of the word of the LORD Against the land of Hadrach, And Damascus its resting place (For the eyes of men And all the tribes of Israel Are on the LORD)
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang hil kơ char Hadrak, sư gô oei tơ pơlei Đamas. Yua kơ măt bơngai Isơrael păng đĭ-đăng kon bơngai tă kơ lăng tơ Kră Yang ngăl.

English: Also against Hamath, which borders on it, And against Tyre and Sidon, though they are very wise.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r noh kư̆m pơma kơ Hamat, tơring jê̆ pơlei Đamas, tơ gah Tirơ păng Siđôn, yua kơ lu pơlei noh tih hlôh wao

English: For Tyre built herself a tower, Heaped up silver like the dust, And gold like the mire of the streets.
Bahnar: yua kơ tơ Tirơ đei man boih minh pôm kơđông kơjăp kơ sư kơdih păng mong jên hu thoi 'mui teh, maih se thoi rơpŭk rok trong.

English: Behold, the Lord will cast her out; He will destroy her power in the sea, And she will be devoured by fire.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang gô iŏk pơdrâu lê̆ mŭk drăm sư păng gô klơ̆m lê̆ tơdrong mơdrŏng sư tơ lăm đak dơsĭ, na ŭnh sa goh.

English: Ashkelon shall see it and fear; Gaza also shall be very sorrowful; And Ekron, for He dried up her expectation. The king shall perish from Gaza, And Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
Bahnar: Pơlei Askalon gô 'bôh păng hli; Gasa kư̆m 'bôh păng jĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ sŭk; pơlei Ekrôn kư̆m lei-lăi, yua kơ dôm tơdrong sư chang hơmĕng gô hiong tôch; pơtao pơlei Gasa đe gô pơlôch păng pơlei Askalon gô pă đei kon pơlei oei.

English: “A mixed race shall settle in Ashdod, And I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơmoi gô oei lăm pơlei Asdôt; Inh gô tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong pơang lu bơngai Philistin.

English: I will take away the blood from his mouth, And the abominations from between his teeth. But he who remains, even he shall be for our God, And shall be like a leader in Judah, And Ekron like a Jebusite.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh gô iŏk pham đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư păng tơdrong kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm hơnĕnh lu sư; lu khŭl sư mă oei đei gô jing khŭl Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n, sư kư̆m thoi yŏng kơdră adrĕch Juđa păng Ekrôn thoi bơngai Jêbus.

English: I will camp around My house Because of the army, Because of him who passes by and him who returns. No more shall an oppressor pass through them, For now I have seen with My eyes.
Bahnar: Inh gô war bơwei tăp dăr kơ hnam Inh, tơblah hăm lu linh, wă ưh kơ đei bu mơ̆t lĕch. Lu bơngai pơgô̆ đe ưh pă đei pơgô̆ boih, yua kơ dang ei măt Inh lăng bơwei sư.

English: “Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion! Shout, O daughter of Jerusalem! Behold, your King is coming to you; He is just and having salvation, Lowly and riding on a donkey, A colt, the foal of a donkey.
Bahnar: Ơ kon drŏ-kăn Siôn chơt hiôk bĕ đĭ-đăng! Ơ kon drŏ-kăn Jêrusalem, jreo tơkĕch chơt hiôk bĕ! 'Nâu, pơtao lu iĕm truh tơ lu iĕm boih, Sư jơ̆ tơpăt ăn tơdrong dŏng pơklaih, iŏk đon ala hao aseh iĕ, wă khan kon aseh yŏng.

English: I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim And the horse from Jerusalem; The battle bow shall be cut off. He shall speak peace to the nations; His dominion shall be ‘from sea to sea, And from the River to the ends of the earth.’
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm lu gre aseh đơ̆ng Êphraim păng aseh đơ̆ng Jêrusalem; hră mă đe tơblah Inh gô gơ̆ lê̆ păng Sư gô sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ adrĕch kon bơngai; tơdrong mơsêh Sư truh tơ jơ̆p lăm đak dơsĭ âu truh tơ dơsĭ to, đơ̆ng glung tih truh tơ tôch kơ teh đak.

English: “As for you also, Because of the blood of your covenant, I will set your prisoners free from the waterless pit.
Bahnar: “Gah ih kư̆m lei-lăi, yua kơ đơ̆ng pham tơdrong Inh pơgơ̆p hăm ih, na Inh gô pơklaih lu bơnă đơ̆ng sơlŭng mă ưh kơ đei đak.

English: Return to the stronghold, You prisoners of hope. Even today I declare That I will restore double to you.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai bơnă mă đei tơdrong gơnang chang gô, brŏk bĕ tơ anih kơjăp, lăm năr âu boih inh khan gô pơm 'mong ăn kơ ih hloh 'bar wơ̆t dơ̆ng.

English: For I have bent Judah, My bow, Fitted the bow with Ephraim, And raised up your sons, O Zion, Against your sons, O Greece, And made you like the sword of a mighty man.”
Bahnar: Inh gô gŭt Juđa thoi hră păng Êphraim jing 'brơ̆m sư; Inh gô pơdrŭt lu kon drŏ-nglo ih, ơ Siôn, tơblah hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo ih, ơ char Grĕk; Inh gô yua lu iĕm thoi đao lu bơngai tơblah.”

English: Then the LORD will be seen over them, And His arrow will go forth like lightning. The Lord GOD will blow the trumpet, And go with whirlwinds from the south.
Bahnar: Dang ei Kră Yang gô tơ'bôh kơ lu sư, 'brơ̆m sư prah thoi kơmlat; Kră Yang gô hlôm keng păng năm hơdai hăm kial hơbŭt gah gơal

English: The LORD of hosts will defend them; They shall devour and subdue with slingstones. They shall drink and roar as if with wine; They shall be filled with blood like basins, Like the corners of the altar.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô tơgŭm dŏng lu sư, lu sư gô pơrăm hăm jei kơplah klơ̆m tơmo, lu sư gô huch suai ôr tơjrông tơjrang đơ̆ng sik hơmu pơm kơ lu sư, lu sư phĭ hrăp thoi pơnhan thoi đe hling tơ lu mum jơ̆ng gơ'bang soi.

English: The LORD their God will save them in that day, As the flock of His people. For they shall be like the jewels of a crown, Lifted like a banner over His land
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư gô dŏng pơklaih lu kon pơlei sư thoi lu triu, kư̆m thoi minh tơmo gĭt lăm môk pơtao gô pơchrang kơpal teh.

English: For how great is its goodness And how great its beauty! Grain shall make the young men thrive, And new wine the young women.
Bahnar: Tơdrong sư pơm 'lơ̆ng rai 'lơ̆ng dêh tơpă! Sik 'ba mi gô pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai tơdăm rai pran păng sik 'nao gô pơm ăn kơ lu adruh hơlai đei pŭn hiôk.

English: Ask the LORD for rain In the time of the latter rain. The LORD will make flashing clouds; He will give them showers of rain, Grass in the field for everyone.
Bahnar: Apinh bĕ đak 'mi đơ̆ng Kră Yang kơplah bơyan 'mi wă tôch, na Kră Yang gô ăn kơmlat păng tơjur đak 'mi rơkah rơkai, wă ăn kơ rim 'nu bơngai đei hla 'nhot sa đơ̆ng mir.

English: For the idols speak delusion; The diviners envision lies, And tell false dreams; They comfort in vain. Therefore the people wend their way like sheep; They are in trouble because there is no shepherd.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu rup man chă pơma pơhlŭ lu pơjâu 'bôh hơlĕnh đĕch; lu sư roi tơdrong lu sư hơpo hơlĕnh, sư pơlung ngôi đĕch ưh kơ đei yua kiơ. Thoi noh na kon pơlei tơklah tơklang thoi triu, đe pơmat lu sư yua kơ ưh pă đei bơngai wei.

English: “My anger is kindled against the shepherds, And I will punish the goatherds. For the LORD of hosts will visit His flock, The house of Judah, And will make them as His royal horse in the battle.
Bahnar: “Tơdrong blĕk Inh iung hil kơ lu bơngai wei, Inh gô phak lu bơbe tơno; yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô năm lăng khŭl triu Sư, wă khan hnam Juđa; păng pơjing lu sư pran thoi aseh tơblah đe ang.

English: From him comes the cornerstone, From him the tent peg, From him the battle bow, From him every ruler together.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lu sư gô đei tơmo mum hnam, đơ̆ng lu sư đei 'long đe pơ̆ng hnam khăn, đơ̆ng lu sư đei hră tơblah, đơ̆ng lu sư gô đei lu kră pơgơ̆r

English: They shall be like mighty men, Who tread down their enemies In the mire of the streets in the battle. They shall fight because the LORD is with them, And the riders on horses shall be put to shame.
Bahnar: mă-lei lu sư jơ̆ lu bơngai nuih pran pơjuă lu ayăt kơ lu sư, thoi đe pơjuă teh hlŭt rok trong đe năm tơblah; lu sư gô blah jei, yua kơ Kră Yang oei hơdai lu sư, na lu linh ayăt hao aseh gô thuơ păng mơlâu kơ lu sư.

English: “I will strengthen the house of Judah, And I will save the house of Joseph. I will bring them back, Because I have mercy on them. They shall be as though I had not cast them aside; For I am the LORD their God, And I will hear them.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ hnam Juđa jing pran păng dŏng pơklaih hnam Jôsep. Inh chông tơwih lu sư brŏk, yua kơ 'mêm mơnat kơ lu sư, lăng lu sư thoi Inh ưh tam layơ achăng lê̆ lu sư, yua kơ Inh Kră Yang lu sư, Inh gô tơl tơwih nơ̆r lu sư krao apinh.

English: Those of Ephraim shall be like a mighty man, And their heart shall rejoice as if with wine. Yes, their children shall see it and be glad; Their heart shall rejoice in the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơngai Êphraim gô thoi bơngai nuih pran kơtang, jơhngơ̆m lu sư chhôk hal thoi suai kơ et sik hơmu; kon sâu lu sư gô 'bôh păng chơt hiôk tơpă, jơhngơ̆m lu sư chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang.

English: I will whistle for them and gather them, For I will redeem them; And they shall increase as they once increased.
Bahnar: Inh wă krao pơpôi lu sư, yua kơ Inh huai iŏk lu sư boih; lu sư đei thim rai lơ thoi sơ̆.

English: “I will sow them among the peoples, And they shall remember Me in far countries; They shall live, together with their children, And they shall return.
Bahnar: Inh gô săi tơraih lu sư tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak, lu sư mă đơ̆ng dêh char ataih gô 'blŏk kơ Inh; lu sư gô oei arih hơdai brŏk tơ kon akăn kơdih.

English: I will also bring them back from the land of Egypt, And gather them from Assyria. I will bring them into the land of Gilead and Lebanon, Until no more room is found for them.
Bahnar: Thoi ei na Inh gô anhăk lu sư brŏk đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ, pơpôi akŭm lu sư đơ̆ng char Asiri, ba lu sư mơ̆t lăm teh đak Gileat păng Liban păng lu sư gô chă anih oei ưh kơ mah.

English: He shall pass through the sea with affliction, And strike the waves of the sea: All the depths of the River shall dry up. Then the pride of Assyria shall be brought down, And the scepter of Egypt shall depart.
Bahnar: Lu sư yak hlôi kơ đak dơsĭ anat dêh, yak rok đak dơsĭ poh-yă, đơ̆ng noh dơ̆ng dôm lu đak krong Nil mă jrŭ gô hrĕng kro, Inh gô pơrăm lê̆ đĭ dôm tơdrong pơang char Asiri păng 'long jra pơtao Êyiptơ gô hiong đĭ.

English: “So I will strengthen them in the LORD, And they shall walk up and down in His name,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư pran kơtang lăm Kră Yang păng Lu sư yak năm lăm anăn Kră Yang.” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Open your doors, O Lebanon, That fire may devour your cedars.
Bahnar: Ơ Liban, pơih bĕ 'măng, wă kơ ŭnh sa pơđĭ 'long dơnơ̆ng ih!

English: Wail, O cypress, for the cedar has fallen, Because the mighty trees are ruined. Wail, O oaks of Bashan, For the thick forest has come down.
Bahnar: Ơ 'long hơngo krao ôr bĕ! Yua kơ tơm 'long dơnơ̆ng păk boih, dôm lu tơnơm 'long 'lơ̆ng pơrăm đĭ boih. Ơ tơm 'long kôih tơ Basan, ôr krao bĕ, yua kơ lu bri kơdrơ̆ng kăl đĭ boih.

English: There is the sound of wailing shepherds! For their glory is in ruins. There is the sound of roaring lions! For the pride of the Jordan is in ruins.
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r ôr nhơ̆m hmoi lu bơngai wei triu! Yua kơ pơrăm đĭ boih tơdrong ư-ang lu sư; đei lu kon dăm-brang grĕnh ôr! Yua kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ Jôrđăn răm đĭ boih.

English: Thus says the LORD my God, “Feed the flock for slaughter
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi âu: “Ăn bĕ lu triu wă pơlôch pơm 'nhĕm sa 'nhĕt

English: whose owners slaughter them and feel no guilt; those who sell them say, ‘Blessed be the LORD, for I am rich’; and their shepherds do not pity them.
Bahnar: lu bơngai răt triu pơlôch đĭ triu pơm 'nhĕm huay kơ jô̆ khan pơm yoch. Lu bơngai mă tĕch lu sư khan: Kră Yang trŏ kơ ư-ang, yua kơ inh mơdrŏng bơih; păng lăm lu bơngai wei triu ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bơngai bu mă 'mêm kơ lu triu.”

English: For I will no longer pity the inhabitants of the land,” says the LORD. “But indeed I will give everyone into his neighbor’s hand and into the hand of his king. They shall attack the land, and I will not deliver them from their hand.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Yua kơ Inh ưh pă 'mêm boih kơ kon bơngai lăm teh âu; mă-lei 'nâu, Inh gô jao rim 'nu bơngai kơ lu rông 'bôt sư kơdih păng lăm ti pơtao lu sư; lu sư gô blah pơjuă teh đak, Inh ưh kơ đei pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng ti đe noh ôh.”

English: So I fed the flock for slaughter, in particular the poor of the flock. I took for myself two staffs: the one I called Beauty, and the other I called Bonds; and I fed the flock.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh ăn lu triu đe wă pơlôch sa 'nhĕt, lu triu noh boih pơmat-tat tơpă tơ lăm khŭl triu. Đơ̆ng noh, Inh iŏk 'bar tŏ 'long jra: Minh pôm krao 'long jra 'mêm mơnat, minh pôm krao 'long jra pơgơ̆p păng Inh ăn kơ lu triu chă sa.

English: I dismissed the three shepherds in one month. My soul loathed them, and their soul also abhorred me.
Bahnar: Lăp lăm minh khei đĕch Inh pơlôch đĭ pêng 'nu bơngai wei triu; Inh pă kĕ ĕnh hăm lu sư boih păng lu sư kư̆m lei-lăi ưh pă lăp kơ Inh.

English: Then I said, “I will not feed you. Let what is dying die, and what is perishing perish. Let those that are left eat each other’s flesh.”
Bahnar: Inh khan thoi âu: “Inh ưh pă jing bơngai wei triu lu iĕm boih. Triu ayơ lôch, lôch bĕ; triu ayơ hiong, hiong bĕ. Bê̆ mă triu oei đei tơkăp tơsa băl tơduă, triu âu sa triu noh.”

English: And I took my staff, Beauty, and cut it in two, that I might break the covenant which I had made with all the peoples.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, inh iŏk 'long jra mă minh krao 'long jra 'mêm mơnat na chơ̆ng hơjăl lê̆, wă pơrăm lê̆ nơ̆r mă đêl Inh đei pơgơ̆p hăm lu kon pơlei.

English: So it was broken on that day. Thus the poor of the flock, who were watching me, knew that it was the word of the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư pơtôch hloi lăm năr noh; thoi noh đĭ-đăng lăm khŭl triu pơmat-tat tơpă, triu mă mơ̆ng kiơ̆ Inh, băt boih noh nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: Then I said to them, “If it is agreeable to you, give me my wages; and if not, refrain.” So they weighed out for my wages thirty pieces of silver.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Tơdah iĕm tơchĕng khan trŏ ăn jên apah Inh, dah ưh lei lê̆.” Lu sư kŏng tơmam apah Inh, noh pêng-jĭt tơpei jên hu.

English: And the LORD said to me, “Throw it to the potter”—that princely price they set on me. So I took the thirty pieces of silver and threw them into the house of the LORD for the potter.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Tôi ba tơpei hu noh mă tơmam gĭt sư apah inh na ba kơ bơngai mă hling sư!” Inh iŏk hloi pêng-jĭt tơpei hu noh năm ba hloi kơ bơngai mă hling sư tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then I cut in two my other staff, Bonds, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.
Bahnar: Đang kơ noh inh chơ̆ng hơjăl lê̆ 'long jra mă pơgơ̆p noh, wă pơtôch tơdrong pơm 'nhŏng oh bre bơngai Juđa, lăm bơngai Isơrael.

English: And the LORD said to me, “Next, take for yourself the implements of a foolish shepherd.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Iŏk bĕ kơ ih kơdih dôm lu tơmam đơ̆ng lu bơngai wei triu ưh kơ brĕ.

English: For indeed I will raise up a shepherd in the land who will not care for those who are cut off, nor seek the young, nor heal those that are broken, nor feed those that still stand. But he will eat the flesh of the fat and tear their hooves in pieces.
Bahnar: Yua kơ âu, Inh gô tơiung ăn minh 'nu bơngai plơ̆ng jing bơngai wei-lăng triu kơpal teh âu. Mă-lei sư ưh kơ hiơ̆k kơ triu ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ chơchă lu triu hiong, ưh kơ wă ming lu triu rơka, ưh kơ wă rong lu triu bek jăng, mă-lei 'buh sa lu triu mă bek 'lơ̆ng noh păng hek lê̆ kơchôp lu sư.

English: “Woe to the worthless shepherd, Who leaves the flock! A sword shall be against his arm And against his right eye; His arm shall completely wither, And his right eye shall be totally blinded.”
Bahnar: Răm-'băm tơpă kơ lu bơngai wei triu ưh kơ brĕ, achăng lê̆ triu lu sư! Iŏk đao 'bet kơkŏng ti sư păng koh măt gah 'ma sư; kơkŏng sư jing jo păng măt sư jing tol.”

English: The burden of the word of the LORD against Israel. Thus says the LORD, who stretches out the heavens, lays the foundation of the earth, and forms the spirit of man within him
Bahnar: Pŭ iŏk trăp nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma kơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing kơ plĕnh păng teh păng ăn tơdrong arih tơ lăm kon bơngai bơ̆n, đei khan thoi âu

English: “Behold, I will make Jerusalem a cup of drunkenness to all the surrounding peoples, when they lay siege against Judah and Jerusalem.
Bahnar: “'Nâu, Inh gô pơm ăn kơ pơlei Jêrusalem jing minh pôm kơchŏk pơm kơ kon pơlei mă oei tăp dăr kơ sư; păng tơdah đe wang Jêrusalem boih, kư̆m gô đei tơdrong truh kơ Juđa.

English: And it shall happen in that day that I will make Jerusalem a very heavy stone for all peoples; all who would heave it away will surely be cut in pieces, though all nations of the earth are gathered against it.
Bahnar: Kŭm gô đei tơdrong truh hloi lăm năr noh Inh gô pơm ăn kơ Jêrusalem thoi tơmo, trăp kơ rim adrĕch adrung kon bơngai. Na dôm lu bơngai mă tung sư đei tơdrong jĭ dêh; păng đĭ dôm lu dêh char kơpal teh âu gô blah sư.”

English: In that day,” says the LORD, “I will strike every horse with confusion, and its rider with madness; I will open My eyes on the house of Judah, and will strike every horse of the peoples with blindness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lăm năr noh, Inh gô druh teh rim kơ lu aseh wă kơ lu sư kơdâu hli tơrơ, dôm lu bơngai hao aseh noh gô nhen thoi wơnh; Inh gô bơyar măt Inh lăng tơ Juđa păng Inh gô teh rim aseh lu kon tơring jing măt tol.

English: And the governors of Judah shall say in their heart, ‘The inhabitants of Jerusalem are my strength in the LORD of hosts, their God.’
Bahnar: Dang ei đei lu kră pơgơ̆r char Juđa pơma lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư khan: Lu kon pơlei oei tơ Jêrusalem jing tơdrong pran kơtang inh, Kră Yang Tih Hloh, noh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: In that day I will make the governors of Judah like a firepan in the woodpile, and like a fiery torch in the sheaves; they shall devour all the surrounding peoples on the right hand and on the left, but Jerusalem shall be inhabited again in her own place—Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Inh gô pơm ăn kơ yŏng pơgơ̆r Juđa thoi gŏ blôk lăm tơnuh đei 'long ŭnh khơ̆ng păng kư̆m thoi pla ŭnh khơ̆ng đơ̆ng hơchô̆ hơnong 'ba lu sư soh sa pơđĭ tơ gah 'ma hăm tơ gah 'ngiĕo, lu sư gô soh pơđĭ lu kon pơlei mă oei tăp dăr kơ lu sư; păng kon pơlei Jêrusalem oei đei anih kơ lu sư kơdih kơtă dơnơ̆ng, wă khan pơlei Jêrusalem.”

English: “The LORD will save the tents of Judah first, so that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitants of Jerusalem shall not become greater than that of Judah.
Bahnar: Kră Yang adrol hloh gô dŏng pơklaih dôm lu kơđông Juđa, wă kơ đei tơdrong ư-ang kơ hnam Đawit păng tơdrong ư-ang kơ pơlei Jêrusalem, huay kơ ư-ang hloh Juđa.

English: In that day the LORD will defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem; the one who is feeble among them in that day shall be like David, and the house of David shall be like God, like the Angel of the LORD before them.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Kră Yang boih Tơ'ngla dŏng tơgŭm kon pơlei oei lăm Jêrusalem păng lăm năr noh lu bơngai mă tơrăn hloh gô pran thoi Đawit, hnam Đawit gô nhen thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, gô thoi linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang oei 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: It shall be in that day that I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.
Bahnar: “Lăm năr noh Inh gô chă pơrăm đĭ-đăng pơlei, dêh char ayơ mă blah Jêrusalem.”

English: “And I will pour on the house of David and on the inhabitants of Jerusalem the Spirit of grace and supplication; then they will look on Me whom they pierced. Yes, they will mourn for Him as one mourns for his only son, and grieve for Him as one grieves for a firstborn.
Bahnar: “Inh gô tuh Yang Bơhngol tơdrong pŭn hiôk păng tơdrong krao apinh kơ hnam Đawit păng kơ lu kon pơlei Jêrusalem; lu sư gô lăng tơ Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang mă đêl lu sư 'bet boih; păng lu sư gô nhơ̆m hmoi, nhơ̆m hmoi thoi 'mêm kơ kon dăm lôch, lu sư gô oei lăm tơdrong chhŭr nuih, thoi lu bơngai mă đei tơdrong chhŭr nuih ơh sơ'ngon yua kơ kon kơdră lu sư hiong.

English: In that day there shall be a great mourning in Jerusalem, like the mourning at Hadad Rimmon in the plain of Megiddo.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, gô đei tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi tih dêh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, kư̆m thoi đe nhơ̆m hmoi tih dêh sơ̆ tơ dêh Hadat Rimmôn oei tơ lăm tơmăn glă Mêgiđô

English: And the land shall mourn, every family by itself: the family of the house of David by itself, and their wives by themselves; the family of the house of Nathan by itself, and their wives by themselves
Bahnar: lăm teh âu gô nhơ̆m hmoi, rim adrĕch lu sư kơdih kơdih: Adrĕch adrung hnam Đawit klah pha, lu akăn sư klah pha; adrĕch adrung Nathan klah pha, lu akăn lu sư kư̆m lê̆ pha

English: the family of the house of Levi by itself, and their wives by themselves; the family of Shimei by itself, and their wives by themselves
Bahnar: Adrĕch Lêwi kư̆m klah pha, akăn lu sư kư̆m klah pha

English: all the families that remain, every family by itself, and their wives by themselves.
Bahnar: na dôm lu adrĕch mă oei đei, rim adrĕch klah pha păng akăn lu sư kư̆m klah pha.”

English: “In that day a fountain shall be opened for the house of David and for the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for uncleanness.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh Inh gô pơchoh ăn minh pôm đak glung kơ hnam Đawit păng lu kon pơlei oei lăm Jêrusalem, yua kơ wă ôp tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'mê̆ brư̆.

English: “It shall be in that day,” says the LORD of hosts, “that I will cut off the names of the idols from the land, and they shall no longer be remembered. I will also cause the prophets and the unclean spirit to depart from the land.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: “Lăm năr noh kư̆m đei tơdrong truh, Inh gô tơhiong lê̆ đĭ dôm lu anăn rup yang đơ̆ng lăm teh đak, wă kơ lu sư ưh pă đei bu 'blŏk dơ̆ng; Inh kư̆m gô pơm kơ lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng yang kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach weh lĕch đơ̆ng teh đak âu.

English: It shall come to pass that if anyone still prophesies, then his father and mother who begot him will say to him, ‘You shall not live, because you have spoken lies in the name of the LORD.’ And his father and mother who begot him shall thrust him through when he prophesies.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp tơdah bu mă oei khan lê̆ adrol, na mĕ 'bă lu sư bơngai tơpŭ kơ lu sư, gô khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: ‘E ưh pă arih boih yua kơ e yua anăn Kră Yang pơma hơlĕnh.’ Mĕ 'bă lu sư gô 'bet sư tơdah sư khan lê̆ adrol.

English: “And it shall be in that day that every prophet will be ashamed of his vision when he prophesies; they will not wear a robe of coarse hair to deceive.
Bahnar: Kŭm lăm năr noh, dah lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, wă pơma lê̆ adrol lu sư gô mơlâu gah tơdrong mă đei tơ'bôh kơ lu sư; lu sư kư̆m ưh pă đei hrŭk ao tai đe tanh păng sŏk kon sem brem wă pơma hơlĕnh dơ̆ng.

English: But he will say, ‘I am no prophet, I am a farmer; for a man taught me to keep cattle from my youth.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư gô khan: ‘Inh ưh kơ trŏ 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, mă-lei bơngai choh mir 'ba; yua kơ inh jang chŭn mir đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆.’

English: And one will say to him, ‘What are these wounds between your arms?’ Then he will answer, ‘Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends.’
Bahnar: Dah đei bu apinh: ‘Đêl lu rơka kiơ tơ kơkŏng ih?’ Na sư gô tơl: ‘Rơka inh đei đêl đơ̆ng lăm hnam buăl juăt inh.’ ”

English: “Awake, O sword, against My Shepherd, Against the Man who is My Companion,” Says the LORD of hosts. “Strike the Shepherd, And the sheep will be scattered; Then I will turn My hand against the little ones.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu:* “Ơ đao iung tơblah bĕ hăm lu bơngai wei triu Inh păng blah hăm lu buăl juăt Inh. Blah bĕ lu bơngai wei triu, lê̆ triu tơklah tơklang; păng Inh gô iŏk ti Inh pơm tơwih kơ lu triu iĕ noh.”

English: And it shall come to pass in all the land,” Says the LORD, “That two-thirds in it shall be cut off and die, But one–third shall be left in it
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Gô đei tơdrong truh jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Đei 'bar khŭl lăm pêng khŭl noh gô pơlôch đĭ, oei pă minh khŭl lăm pêng noh oei oei.

English: I will bring the one–third through the fire, Will refine them as silver is refined, And test them as gold is tested. They will call on My name, And I will answer them. I will say, ‘This is My people’; And each one will say, ‘The LORD is my God.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô tah minh puăt lăm pêng noh tơ lăm ŭnh Inh, 'buh lu sư thoi đe 'buh hu, pơlong lăng lu sư thoi đe 'buh maih; lu sư gô ôr krao anăn Inh păng Inh gô tơl tơwih nơ̆r sư; Inh gô khan thoi âu: ‘Noh boih kon pơlei Inh âu.’ Lu sư gô khan: ‘Kră Yang noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh.’ ”

English: Behold, the day of the LORD is coming, And your spoil will be divided in your midst.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, năr Kră Yang truh boih, lu tơmam đơ̆ng lu iĕm tơtông gô klah asong.

English: For I will gather all the nations to battle against Jerusalem; The city shall be taken, The houses rifled, And the women ravished. Half of the city shall go into captivity, But the remnant of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh gô akŭm đĭ-đăng dêh char gô tơblah hăm Jêrusalem păng pơlei tih đe gô iŏk, hnam akŭm đe gô tơgar iŏk, đe gô rôp pơgŏ, lăm minh puăt kon pơlei đe rôp pơm bơnă, mă-lei kon pơlei mă oei đei noh đe huay kơ pơrăm đơ̆ng lăm pơlei tih.

English: Then the LORD will go forth And fight against those nations, As He fights in the day of battle.
Bahnar: Dang ei, Kră Yang gô năm blah hăm lu dêh char noh, kư̆m thoi sư đei blah boih lăm năr tơblah.

English: And in that day His feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, Which faces Jerusalem on the east. And the Mount of Olives shall be split in two, From east to west, Making a very large valley; Half of the mountain shall move toward the north And half of it toward the south.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh; jơ̆ng Sư gô dơ̆ng kơpal kông ôliwơ, kông mă tơklă Jêrusalem gah hơlĕch; păng kông ôliwơ gô pơchah tŏk-bŏk, minh pah gah hơlĕch, minh pah gah bơmơ̆t, dĭng mah jing minh pôm thong jrŭ să; minh puăt kông noh hiŏng tơ gah gơal, minh puăt hiŏng gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: Then you shall flee through My mountain valley, For the mountain valley shall reach to Azal. Yes, you shall flee As you fled from the earthquake In the days of Uzziah king of Judah. Thus the LORD my God will come, And all the saints with You.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô kơdâu ôn tơ lăm sơlŭng trôm kông, yua kơ sơlŭng noh să truh tơ Atsan, lu iĕm gô kơdâu ôn thoi đe kơdâu đơ̆ng teh tơdrŏ chăl Ôsia, pơtao đe Juđa. Dang ei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh gô truh, đĭ-đăng lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh gô truh hơdai ih.

English: It shall come to pass in that day That there will be no light; The lights will diminish.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh ưh pă đei hơdah dơ̆ng, dôm lu chră hơdah gô jing iĕ, ưh kơ đei tơngiĕt dah prĕl jur mơ̆n.

English: It shall be one day Which is known to the LORD— Neither day nor night. But at evening time it shall happen That it will be light.
Bahnar: Noh jing minh năr Kră Yang đĕch băt; ưh kơ sĭ kơ'năr dah kơmăng, mă-lei dah kơsơ̆ truh boih gô đei hơdah.

English: And in that day it shall be That living waters shall flow from Jerusalem, Half of them toward the eastern sea And half of them toward the western sea; In both summer and winter it shall occur.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh đak tơdrong arih gô lĕch ro đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem, minh trong noh ro tơ đak dơsĭ gah hơlĕch, minh trong gô ro tơ dơsĭ gah bơmơ̆t, lăm bơyan 'mi hăm bơyan phang tă kơ đei ngăl.

English: And the LORD shall be King over all the earth. In that day it shall be— “The LORD is one,” And His name one.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm Pơtao jơ̆p kơ teh đak; lăm năr noh, Kră Yang gô jing minh đĕch.

English: All the land shall be turned into a plain from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem. Jerusalem shall be raised up and inhabited in her place from Benjamin’s Gate to the place of the First Gate and the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananel to the king’s winepresses.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng jơ̆p kơ teh đak gô jing teh dơhnă, iŏk đơ̆ng Gêba truh tơ Rimôn. Gah gơal kơ pơlei Jêrusalem, pơlei tih âu đe gô hơtŏk sư tơ anih sư, đơ̆ng 'măng jang Bênjamin truh tơ 'măng jang mă blŭng-a păng truh tơ 'măng jang mum, đơ̆ng hnam thôt Hananêl dĭng truh tơ anih pơtao hmĕt đak hơmu pơm sik.

English: The people shall dwell in it; And no longer shall there be utter destruction, But Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited.
Bahnar: Lu đe gô oei tơ noh, đe ưh pă hiap sư dơ̆ng, mă-lei Jêrusalem gô oei hiôk-hian.

English: And this shall be the plague with which the LORD will strike all the people who fought against Jerusalem: Their flesh shall dissolve while they stand on their feet, Their eyes shall dissolve in their sockets, And their tongues shall dissolve in their mouths.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, 'nâu mă Kră Yang wă phak lu bơngai mă tơblah hăm Jêrusalem: Sư pơm ăn kơ jơ̆ng rim 'nu lu sư bluch kơplah lu sư oei dang dơ̆ng, klong măt lu sư gô ôm lăm măt, đơ̆ng noh hơpiĕt lu sư gô ôm lăm 'bơ̆r lu sư.

English: It shall come to pass in that day That a great panic from the LORD will be among them. Everyone will seize the hand of his neighbor, And raise his hand against his neighbor’s hand
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Kră Yang gô ăn tơdrong hli dêh truh tơ lu sư; yua kơ lu sư gô rôp băl ti tơduă lu sư păng ti bơngai âu gô tơblah hăm ti bơngai to.

English: Judah also will fight at Jerusalem. And the wealth of all the surrounding nations Shall be gathered together: Gold, silver, and apparel in great abundance.
Bahnar: Juđa gô tơblah hăm Jêrusalem păng dôm tơmam đơ̆ng rim kơ dêh char gô pơpôi akŭm đĭ tơ noh; hu maih păng lu ao tai hơ'bơ̆l lơ tơpă.

English: Such also shall be the plague On the horse and the mule, On the camel and the donkey, And on all the cattle that will be in those camps. So shall this plague be.
Bahnar: Păng kư̆m đei toi truh tơ lu aseh, lu lăk-đa, aseh bri păng đĭ-đăng lu kon sem dơrong lăm kơđông linh, tă kơ đei toi thoi noh.

English: And it shall come to pass that everyone who is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem shall go up from year to year to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, and to keep the Feast of Tabernacles.
Bahnar: Đei tơdrong truh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă oei đei lăm jơ̆p kơ dêh char gô tŏk blah Jêrusalem, gô tŏk tơ noh rim sơnăm wă kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao, noh boih Kră Yang Tih Hloh păng kư̆m năm kơ năr giĕng bơsŭn.

English: And it shall be that whichever of the families of the earth do not come up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, on them there will be no rain.
Bahnar: Lăm lu adrĕch adrung kon bơngai kơpal teh, lu đe mă ưh kơ đei tŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem wă năm kơkuh kơ pơtao, wă khan Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'mi ưh kơ đei truh tơ lu sư.

English: If the family of Egypt will not come up and enter in, they shall have no rain; they shall receive the plague with which the LORD strikes the nations who do not come up to keep the Feast of Tabernacles.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu adrĕch adrung bơngai Êyiptơ ưh kơ tŏk dah ưh kơ truh tơ noh, na 'mi kư̆m ưh kơ truh tơ lu sư; păng lu sư gô lôch hơbuh 'nâu, noh toi mă Kră Yang yua wă phak lu dêh char mă ưh kơ tŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem wă kơkuh năr giĕng bơsŭn.

English: This shall be the punishment of Egypt and the punishment of all the nations that do not come up to keep the Feast of Tabernacles.
Bahnar: Noh tơdrong phak đe Êyiptơ păng tơdrong phak lu dêh char mă kuă tŏk kơkuh năr giĕng bơsŭn kư̆m thoi noh.

English: In that day “ HOLINESS TO THE LORD ” shall be engraved on the bells of the horses. The pots in the LORD’s house shall be like the bowls before the altar.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, gô chhơ̆ chư tơ krĕng-nĕng aseh thoi âu: “'LƠ̆NG RƠGOH KƠ KRĂ YANG!” Lu gŏ lăm hnam Kră Yang gô nhen thoi lu pơnhan kơpal gơ'bang soi.

English: Yes, every pot in Jerusalem and Judah shall be holiness to the LORD of hosts. Everyone who sacrifices shall come and take them and cook in them. In that day there shall no longer be a Canaanite in the house of the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Dôm lu gŏ lăm pơlei Jêrusalem păng lăm Juđa gô jing rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh; wă kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang truh, iŏk gŏ noh na pai păng lăm năr noh, gô ưh pă đei minh 'nu bơngai Kanaana lăm hnam Kră Yang Tih Hloh.
